name: Wmcchat
body:
### WMcChat
Hello there, welcome to my website for WMcChat! WMcChat is a Minecraft chat client, similar to MineChat, except for the web!

### Why use WMcChat?
We have Minecraft. We have MineChat. Why make another chat client?
WMcChat aims to be different. Unlike the other clients:
* WMcChat does not store any files on your computer (unlike Minecraft)
* WMcChat does not require downloading anything (unlike Minecraft)
* WMcChat is not resource intensive (unlike Minecraft)
* WMcChat can be put on a website - see usage below
* WMcChat can be used on computers (unlike MineChat)

### Current status
Version 2.0 is going to be the next release:
* Neater, smaller GUI
* Better connecting to server system
* Temporarily storing join/leave information so it can join other servers quicker
* Support for formatted text (bold, italics etc.)
* Fixed up typos

Version 3.0 ideas:
* List of servers which can be defined by the person who embedded WMcChat into the webpage

Caveats:
* Java doesn't work on 64bit systems on Mac - honestly, not my fault but it's the only caveat we have here...

### Usage
How do you use this? Firstly, you need Java 7. Sorry Java 6 fans, I've tried but it requires the Java 7 features to work properly. Then, you need this code here:
<font color="#ff0000">I seriously recommend not doing this because this is WMcChatMini and is kinda outdated</font>

```
<embed id="WMcChat" type="application/x-java-applet;version=1.6" width="298" height="380" archive="https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/77591131/MyApplet1.jar, https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/77591131/MCProtocolLib.jar" code="com.droppages.Skepter.Start" pluginspage="http://java.com/download/">
<param name="permissions" value="all-permissions">
```

Simply, put this code anywhere on the web - on the internet, on your website (especially on your website). It's embeddable and that code can put it anywhere which accepts HTML.

### FAEAQ (Frequent and easily answered questions)
* Q: It's a scam! They store your password and try to hack your account!
* A: No, seriously guys - this is not a scam. It uses the same code as the regular Minecraft login and is 100% safe. If it makes you feel better, I don't even know how to store that information in the first place.
